mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Minions' all-silliness all-the-time philosophy will put a smile on faces and keep it there, like a fizzy beverage on a hot afternoon.
The action sequences are wild, the jokes relentlessly dumb-but-smart, and the sheer sense of anything-goes daftness...is glorious.
The breakout stars of the Despicable Me franchise seize the spotlight in an enjoyably demented off-shoot that is guaranteed to send their young fans bananas.
A surprisingly demented delight; a crazy, spirited, if simplistic fusion of off-beat adult humour blended with the sensibility of an anarchic toddler.
All nutty, all nonsensical, all aboard.
It’s relentless in its depiction of the slapstick-infused shenanigans that will keep the little ones entranced in their seats.
Minions lives and dies on its sight gags and luckily for Coffin and Balda they are almost non-stop.

The good news is that the minions are more (unconsciously, if perhaps also strategically) in touch with their anarchic side than the typical onesie-wearing crusader, which suits the directors Pierre Coffin and Kyle Balda’s well-tuned sense of the absurd.
While the minions are certainly little, yellow and different, Minions has probably mined them for about as much comedy as they can provide as leading men.
Stronger on concept than story, Brian Lynch’s Minions script emphasizes scale over quantity.
Best yet, there’s a mid-film bedtime story, made to look like stop-motion, that’ll take your breath away.

Many of the jokes are either obvious or have been exposed through pre-release marketing material. I kept waiting for the clever or insightful moment that never arrives. The bar is set pretty low for Minions.
There can be too much of a goofily good thing.
I, too, once enjoyed the Minions, in the small doses that they came in. But the extra-strength Minions is, for better or for worse, too much of a good thing.
Minions will tickle the very young and has roughly twice as many laughs as those Disney “Planes” pictures, or Pixar’s “Monster’s University.” So “Kumbaya,” kids, kumbaya.
There are a number of laughs to be had in what ends up being an uneven but surprisingly likeable dose of low-calorie nonsense.
Introduced in “Despicable Me” in 2010, those yellow, pill-shaped, gibberish-speaking “Minions” now have their own spinoff — and they still ride a fine line between irritating and adorable.
Farty, burpy, fall-y over fun tied to a pretty inconsequential plot. Your kids will explode with joy.
The new team thinks that if mayhem is funny, five times the mayhem will be five times as hilarious. That’s not how movie math works, and too many scenes spin out of control.
If Minions were a toy, you’d hide its batteries.

The questions is: Can the minions carry a movie all by their mischievous mini-selves? 'Fraid not. This origin story, while being utterly harmless and far from despicable, wears out its welcome way too soon.
With its episodic stream of slapstick gags, Minions has moment of piquant absurdity, but mostly it’s shrill-but-cutesy anarchy works as a visual sugar rush for the preschool set.
It's a buzzkill to enter the world of Minions primed for a tidal wave of gibberish-talking lemmings to tear the roof off, only to see them once again led astray by the ordinariness of human affairs.
Comedy and narrative demand more rhythm than simply scamper, jabber, fall but that's what Minions bring to the table.
What Minions does have is abundant if relentless cuteness, which audiences are sure to accept in lieu of content; people love these little guys.
You’ll have to appreciate what fleeting cleverness you can here.

The Minions themselves aren't as endearing as they are in the previous movies, maybe because there are fewer of them bumbling around, or maybe because they just haven't found their true supervillain love yet. Or maybe some sidekicks, no matter how loveable, just aren't cartoon-hero material
Minions is product, pure and simple. Little kids will love it, but grown-ups will feel like they’re being held hostage in a Fisher-Price test laboratory.
Minions has idiosyncratic roots, but it’s a franchise play all the way. Finally, even 5-year-olds have their own movie that mechanically cashes in on something they loved when they were younger.
It's all perfectly OK, and even, at times, delightful.... Yet Minions doesn't add up to all that it should.
The story [lacks] a clear narrative or emotional throughline to connect all of the film’s setpieces.
What’s surprising about Minions is that it squanders these yellow oddballs’ new-found freedom.

By far, the highlight of Minions is hearing The Beatles’ “Got To Get You Into My Life” over the closing credits — the first time I think I’ve ever heard it used in a movie. Otherwise, the prequel to “Despicable Me” is like trying to form a rock band out of three Ringos.
The marketing engine of Minions is undeniably powerful. This is something craftily designed to sell toys and theme park tickets and special cans of Tic-tacs. But it’s not a movie. It’s an eyesore.

The bottom line is that the filmmakers are working with nothing here — no characters to speak of, no interpersonal relationships, no story with any suspense or capacity to engage, and no script with any humor or wit. What can they do?

mc_user_reviews.text: Silly Minions from Despicable Me are just as silly and adorable in this prequel of the aforementioned cartoon. There is nothing deep in this type of humor, so if you didn't like Minions and their jibber-jabber during the previous two installments, chances are you will find this ridiculous and/or annoying. For the fans, they should still find stuff to enjoy. Not to say that it could have been done much better and funnier, but still... Funniest stuff for me comes at the beginning (which was basically all the stuff from the trailers) and in the end, where I had some genuine LOL moments. The stuff in between is "hit or miss", but it was enough entertain me. The movie is not too long by today's standards, which is another plus.

Minions is the prequel film that explains how the Minions came to be and how they met their master, Gru. Being a fan of the first 2 Despicable Me films, I was very hopeful that this would be good, but also very scared, because honestly, there's not enough substance to carry a whole film. Overall, it's not as good as the films before it, but it is still a nice addition to the franchise. I thought hearing just the minions for an hour and a half would get very tiresome, but they managed to make it work by adding human characters, while still keeping focus on the Minions. In this film we have an all-star cast that ranges from Sandra Bullock to Geoffrey Rush and Micheal Keaton. They all did a fine job at the rules they were given. I do have a few complaints with the film. It does seem to drag on a little bit but still manages to pick itself back up by the finale. A lot of the jokes were pointed towards kids, even more so than both Despicable Me, but the best jokes are the ones that kids may not get. There is a ton of references to 60's culture, and it's pretty cool to see something for the adults to enjoy.My biggest problem is that the story is really all over the place, It can't really stay focused on one thing for more than 10 minutes, and it gets a bit distracting. Overall, with a killer soundtrack and a ton of humor kids and adults will enjoy, even with the crumby story and a few flat jokes, Minions is still an enjoyable animated film, just not the best one this year.

Going into Minions, I was a bit worried based on all of the critic reviews while at the same time a bit optimistic. Ultimately, this movie has an okay first half, but a really good second half. I wouldn't say it would be on the level of the two Despicable Me films though. Only watch this if you really want to expand your knowledge of the minions' past.
Although having an uninteresting plot, it is a hilarious film with the Minions doing what is expected of them: to entertain. (Had a lot of laughs in the run of the movie.)

As a child, I enjoyed the film. It was perfectly stupid but funny at the same time. It's amazing how developed a character can be without speaking throughout the entire film. I wouldn't have thought most adults would enjoy this, it's a very childish film but it's great for young kids and families. I would recommend this film to any family with children under 15! Great family fun!

People clearly had their expectations set too high here. The Minions are simple characters so it's not like a movie based around them would be Pixar level! I enjoyed the film for what it was, it's great if you just want to sit back and watch some slapstick. The weakest link though, is Scarlett Overkill. Her name is actually pretty fitting because she's too over-the-top and frankly, annoying. I mean, one minute her dress flaps like a normal dress and the next it's a cannon? Also there is only one place she could have put the missiles up there and you do not want to know where it is. But the Minions carry the movie surprisingly well, the movie is pretty enjoyable. Watch it for some laughs. It's better than they give it credit for.
I soo love this movie because these minions are too cute. They also have one of the best soundtracks and I enjoyed watching this film.

I HATE this movie. It is the MOST disappointing follow up to some great movies EVER. I mean we've already seen that it doesn't work if you put the comedic relief in its own movie. (Like Kronk's New Groove) Except, Kronk's New Groove was BETTER than Minions, and Kronk's New Groove is a Disney Toon Studios movie. I expect more in Despicable Me 3.

This 'movie*' was so unfunny, so unoriginal, so repetitive and it teaches your kids that to be evil is a cool** thing. The animation looked bad. It was just fart jokes and other immature things. My 6 year-old  son saw it and it gave him autism.

The Minions were so good and so funny in both "Despicable" movies. I expected more of the same, but did not get it. The funniest part of this movie actually takes place before the the movie starts. After that it's a few moderate chuckles on top of a really thin story. I did not expect Citizen Cane, but I did expect something on par with the "Despicable" movies. This is not even close.

It's a mindless comedy and you need to go in expecting that or you definetly will not enjoy this film. Minions is dumb but funny slapstick humor. Bullock and Hamm are also great in their roles. Unfortunately, most of the good slapstick was given away in the trailers, hurting my rating of this film. Minions is a film that you can get a kick out of watching once, but no more than that.

Again, the critics were wrong. Okay they fooled me, even the audience score, which I usually rely on at rotten tomatoes was at 68%!!! Like seriously, this is actually entertaining and fun. I wasn't disappointed at all and this was exactly what I paid $10 for. From the opening scene, I knew this would be funny. Sandra Bullock is good as the villain, and the minions are cute. Great lead up to Despicable Me and made sense as they couldn't keep a leader, but found Gru. On the downside, the theater wasn't as crowded as Inside Out was and my theater was sold out but only had 96 seats.

A Hodge podge of ideas are never successfully converted into a totally successful story and this ‘Despicable Me’ offshoot can really only be recommended to Minion fans. The animation is very good and the soundtrack is wonderfully interjected with some classic 60’s songs. Also for the adult movie buffs in the audience there are plenty of references to other films one of which, if I’m not mistaken, is a homage to ‘The creature from the Black Lagoon’? The villain here voiced by Sandra Bullock is the aptly titled Scarlet Overkill. However, the character lacks the sinister villainy of Despicable Me’s ‘Gru’. I don’t wish to be too harsh on the film because there are some truly inspired moments. The early narrated scenes depicting the Minions in search of the greatest villain they can find is a lot of fun as are the scenes at the Tower of London. Unfortunately, though, not being a true Minion convert I watched proceedings rather impassively laughing at only a couple of inspired sight gags. Ultimately, one is left to conclude that this is a film for children or diehard fans only.

Minions is ok. it's fairly funny and had some cool characters. but the problem is that without the Despicable Me cast there is way too much of the minions and it doesn't fully work and just seems like a ton of sequences that have been tied together rather loosely. i also thought the really talented cast were wasted. that being said i enjoyed the film and i think some of the best moments are the background gags but it need to be better written to keep the entire audience engaged. oh and the 3D was good but slightly too gimmicky

The villain is poorly cast (Sandra Bullock). Very one dimensional character. Can be blown up, smashed by a chandelier but cant withstand an ice blast...Cmon. The whole movie is like a terrible SNL skit but it has to last an hour and a half. Kids will eat it up of course but adults and parent will be bored.
This movie is for anybody without a sane sense of humor, or for anybody has not passed the age of  'Oh cutie!'. The plot is awful and stupid, and the characters don't make any sense.
minions the movie ruined my life all my friends and my family post minion memes and i get cyberbullied and everyone doesnt like me  HELP??????????????! jump

A riot of invention and slapstick humour, Minions is sure to delight little kids and adults who are still kids at heart. Always the best thing about the Despicable Me movies, the Minions breakout in their very own origin story detailing their centuries long search for an evil master to serve. With little in the way of dialogue, and a plot thats gossamer thin, Minions works thanks to brilliant creative writing and inspired voice work. A blast from start to finish

Sure, this isn't close to the level of both Despicable Me films, but if you feel like turning your brain off and having a good laugh you should watch this. It's fun and adorable and there are quite a few hidden jokes too. Not a super quality film by any means, but this is mainly for children, and they'll enjoy the hell out of this.

The movie is ultimately bad. The Despicable me I, II were much more interesting. It looks like this movie was outsourced to some cheap and lousy company. I cannot believe that it was created by the same team.

In an age of below mediocre kids films such as Home, Tommorowland, Planes, with the list growing ever larger. Minions is a film that no only works well but complements the source material on which it is based upon, working with colorful new characters such as Herb and Scarlet Overkill played by Jon Hamm and Sandra Bullock, respectively who give great performances in their first voice roles ever as the despicable villains of the film, but it is the main highlight of the film that is of course Pierre Coffin who portrays the odd and somewhat mentally challenged Kevin, Bob and Stuart on a quest to find a new master who is evil diabolical and of course has a high mortality rate. Filled with the occasional slapstick humor and moments of complete goofiness. The minion movie is well worth a watch for any age group
Its fun and the kids will love it. Little bits for the adults too. I especially enjoyed the English obsession with tea. Scarlet Overkill isn't a great villain but overall OK..
My Granddaughter loved it, and in the end, that's all that really matters...
i want a minion to fist mei want a minion to fist mei want a minion to fist mei want a minion to fist mei want a minion to fist mei want a minion to fist me

What's wrong with this idea?  Let's make a cartoon with hundreds of ugly dwarfs whom you can't understand and let's make it VIOLENT, the main premise, the search for a villain to worship. Not entertaining, not funny.  The ONLY memorable thing about the movie was I had to pay $2 more than my 4&6 yr old grandchildren.

I stood in the pouring rain in California, hailed a cab and wasted twenty dollars of my own money to see this abomination with my family. Let me state to emphasize, THIS MOVIE IS AN ABSOLUTE **** WASTE OF YOUR MONEY AND TIME. No subtitles on the generic minion main characters throughout the entire movie. No Gru until the very end and even then its just his toddler form. But the biggest crime? SANDRA BULLOCK WRITTEN BORING?! That is NOT how you make use of a good actress movie...NO....just no.
Short, but effective injections of comedy. Tied with moderate, yet satisfying character development with minimal dialogue. Minions is a refreshing family film, filled with fresh fun for the summer.

After seeing this movie, I've lost my will to live. My father left the movie about half way in and I haven't seen him since. My mother has taken her own life and I'm sitting here with a rope and a gun just trying to find out how I want to go.
Before watching this film: I have not seen Despicable Me 1 or 2 in the cinemas but had seen some clips on TV.
Pesima Pelicula Aburrida..Realmente ME ESTABA DURMIENDO observando tanta tonteria recurrente chistes sin sentido, de lo peor que he observado
If you liked the Minions is DM then you will be bummed.  This movie has a bad and convoluted story, with no real payoff, and very few laughs. What a disappointment.

I had my doubts about this movie. Minions are annoying nowadays and are abused as a meaning of selling merchandise. But this film ticked most of the boxes needed for a good animation film. To start negatively, this film was rushed as f*ck. Honestly, scarlet overkill had just the worst build up to an antagonist I've ever seen in a movie. It was so quick and should've started with a little more context. Also, the action sequences were too rushed and should've had a more quick slapstick humour to them (i'm not saying they didn'y, but more would be nice). This being said, the comedy in this movie was exemplary as the minions are just too adorable in trying to understand a foreign world to them. The references to British pop culture in the 60's/70's were on point and added great comedic value to a film that means both children and adults will enjoy. Not the worst, but really not the best animated film out there.
Despite its simple yet ridiculous premise, Minions is a fun time with the family; it is cute and cuddly with humor that pleases both the kids and their parents.

this is another franchise that has been milked for money, I dont really like the movies made in 2014 and 15 because the movie industries have ran out of idea, the movie does have a little bit of humor but its a little to repetitive and also in the trailer they made it look a little bit more promising(already knowing movie isnt going to be to great because of the previous ones), but they made it look interesting how they made people curious of were did the come from. In the story I didnt like how the did the beginning to much, expecting something a little more different but you know its whatever

Anyone who has seen either "Despicable Me" knows that the minions are the cutest characters in the movies. Their occasionally intelligible jibberish never gets old and the silly slapstick always generates a smile, if not a laff. Three of them set out to find a new evil boss, only to get sidetracked with a plot to save the world. Most of the action is set in '60s London and the swinging period soundtrack adds upbeat nostalgic fun. While some of the gags are genuinely funny (and there are plenty of in-jokes for the grownups), the story wears thin and an endless energy makes up for true hilarity. Still, less discriminating younger viewers are bound to be delighted. NOTE: Stay thru the credits for a Beatles song featuring the entire cast.

Illumination Entertainment made this movie... so the Illuminati made this movie. As predicted, it has made them money, so much of it, in fact that they are the 2nd highest grossing animated movie of all time. Do not support this movie, unless you want to support the Illuminati.

Honestly the real and main reason why the studio (Universal) decided to make this movie at all is because how popular Minions is , they just everywhere know from toys to even some ride in Universal Amusement Park.
7--Good for the Kids, Not so Much for the Adults
I haven't even seen the movie, I just want to come here to say that Minions are the worst thing on the planet, I wish to kill them all. They are everywhere now, we must stop this virus.

I never got the point while watching the despicable movies, why I should find minions funny, and apart from a few chuckles, this film dedicated entirely to them felt like I wasting too much money on something I shouldn't have.

While the minions themselves aren't capable of carrying their own movie with a coherent plot and characters, Minions is enjoyable, amusing escapist fun that small children will undoubtedly enjoy with its dumb slapstick humour.

If you've ever seen Despicable Me or its sequel, you will definitely remember the little yellow tic-tacs called the Minions. They stole the show in almost every scene they were in, and they were memorable and cute little sidekicks. However, too much of a good thing isn't necessarily a good thing, and the origin story for the Minions is the perfect example of that. Minions shows what those little bananas did before they met Gru as they journey to the International Supervillain Convention in 1968 and become henchmen to the world's most notorious villain, Scarlet Overkill. The issues with Minions are present from the very first scene and continue throughout the entire film. Much of the humor, as agonizing as this sounds, is supposed to come from the way the Minions talk. That wears out its welcome extremely quickly as you can imagine. Even the jokes that don't concern the Minions are reused numerous times throughout the film, making this movie tedious and repetitive. That could be somewhat forgiven if Minions had interesting characters or a compelling enough story, but unfortunately, this film has none of that. The Minions aren't exactly dramatic characters; they're always the sidekicks, destined to be overshadowed by the villains they serve. Even Scarlet Overkill is a fairly generic villain. She doesn't have any sort of special powers or a unique personality to distinguish herself from other power-hungry female villains. There's never any sort of drama or development with her character. Now onto the unfocused and rushed plot. If you have the attention span of a goldfish, you might find the plot of Minions to be fun, but anyone else will feel like they're being suffocated by the insanity of this film. This movie just never takes a break. There's never a moment where you can calm your senses from the insanity of the previous scene, and it's not because it's some action-packed spectacle. It seemed like the filmmakers were trying to fit as much as they possibly could into each scene so that much younger kids wouldn't be bored. Minions might entertain the least demanding moviegoers and their very young children, but anyone else should stay away from the contrived plot, tired jokes and dull characters littered throughout this movie.

I was never a big fan of Despicable Me (haven't seen the second one) but Minions turning out so mediocre still disappointed me because the trailer promised a fun film that seemed to be a lot better than what we ended up having. The problem is a lack of engaging story-line, there were no real stakes to it.

this was not what i had in mind going in to see the minions but however it was cute funny and  entertaining enough to atleast admit i liked it really missed the girls though wish they would have atleast shown up but it was good enough i loved bob

While it's not oscar-worthy by any means. Minions is still a fun movie, a lot of the jokes are funny the presentation is great, and the soundtrack is good but not very memorable. Unfortunately the story isn't very deep and Scarlett Overkill isn't a very good villain.

Wasn't sure if making a movie about secondary character would work especially when they don't speak english, but this movie was enjoyable maybe not the best animated flick this summer but definitely worth watching if you enjoyed despicable me.

I love the minions. Somewhat ironically, but almost nostalgically. Although Despicable Me came out only about 5 years ago, but Universal wastes no time with Minions. Give the people what they want! (Although I'm not sure this is quite what the people want. I didn't need to see a minion in a thong.)

The minions are great sidekicks, and sometimes they have hit such hilarious moments in the despicable me franchise that it was hard to dislike them, they are such good characters for comedic effect. But for comedic effect only. They truly cannot carry their own film, and their repeated jokes and gags get rapidly boring, only appealing to the kind of audience who enjoys raunchy and mindless humour. And that is about everything I can say about minions, because this movie is stretched to such thin material, that I find no purpose in talking about story or character development or moral messages because there are none. I would recommend seeing this film if you are a die-hard fan of this franchise, because if you are not, chances are you will end up disliking this film. (P.S, I would not show this film to a kid younger than 6 years old, sometimes it crosses the line)

This movie is a perfect example of what happens when you take a movie series too far. No one needed to know the minions backstory, all people care about is the humor in the movie. I was amazingly excited to see this, and when I saw it, I hated it. Limited Laughs, barely any English, and just a boring and not cute plot. MINIONS will make you want the 91 minutes back in your life, it sure did for me.

I thought the first two Despicable Me films were very enjoyable, but the highlight of both movies were the Minions. I thought they were hilarious. However, I thought they worked well as side characters, I didn't think they would be able to hold their own film. I still hold that opinion. Although the first two films were for families to enjoy, this one is for children. Your kids will laugh their faces off at this, but I don't think its as enjoyable for the parents. Sandra Bullock wasn't the greatest as the main antagonist, however Jon Hamm was a highlight in the film. I found him very entertaining in the role that he played, and he was the funniest thing in this movie. The main (Minion) characters, Stuart, Kevin and Bob were very entertaining, but most of it was slapstick humour you'll find funny the first time you watch it, probably not the next million times your kids chuck the DVD on (Kind of like the first Cars). I'll give the film credit, as its just a bit of harmless fun for the kids, but its not a great film in general. My final thoughts on this film are: Your kids will love it, but try to avoid buying it on DVD when it comes out, and avoid millions of viewings!

The worst part about this film is the great comical opportunities it had, the final result was unfunny slapstick and the rare joke that was actually funny. The story was boring and the minions' language is now intelligible Spanish,Italian and English; it's as if there was no effort put into this movie. The minions were one of the best parts of the original Despicable Me films, but here they tried to give each one a personality and that just didn't work out, all of the characters were not memorable, I wouldn't have cared in they had all died, that would have done for a better story anyways.

Fun movie, jokes were funny but sometimes curde (e.g the noose one, the lady upper private part one) all in all it was funny. I enjoyed going to see it. Been there two times. I would recommend it to those aged 6+

Well... Um... Yeah. I have no words to describe this movie. I remember seeing it with a friend in a theatre full of children and for most of the movie, there was dead silence. There was only one joke I found somewhat funny. So... Yeah this film was not good.

Minions as seen in Despicable movies OK, on their own with no plot and little to no other reason for being on the screen makes for the most useless waste of time I have had in years….only silver lining is that the kids enjoyed it though it was ridiculous.  5 minutes OK, but 1 1/2 hours of Minions….

Subparly entertaining, mediocre, senseless jokes but can still still be considered to be watched for entertainment purpose. It is merely for the continuation of another franchise to further increase box office revenue. It lacks any significant moral value that kids these days should be learning. Not like recent animated releases such as Inside Out which tackles something with relevance and at the same time triumph in visual glory. Minions is just another animated family comedy that will soon be forgotten. Another example of how box office grosses are not a standard in weighing the beauty of a movie

The first two Despicable Me movies were fine, not the worst, but fine. The only reason the Minions were there was for a comedic break, something the movie was kind of lacking of.This movie literally doesn't match with both of the previous Despicable Me movies because in the original, Minions were deformed corn pops Gru made accidentally  in his lab, but in this movie, they were made before man. Obviously, the movie was a way to make more money than they already have. And the publicity of them is SO BAD, they  ruined the definition of minions. And they are comedic supports, so why make a movie out of it? It has ALWAYS failed. So, this movie should have never been made. It's only purpose was to raise money.
Mindless, check. Funny, check. It is a silly, happy comedy for family, and the minions are outrageously adorable.

I bought this movie for my son after seeing the toys everywhere. I had not seen the Despicable Me movies and so did not have much context for what this movie was going to be about. That said, my wife and I were surprised at how violent the movie is - there is even a torture segment - and there are many times where the characters refer directly to trying to kill each other.
我不得不說，小小兵瞄準觀眾，以觀眾為主要目標

i thought it was very funny i enjoyed it.  stay after the credits still more funny stuff.  i like the music too good old rock and roll.  i will be getting the dvd when comes out and even the sound track.

Not as good as I expected but just to see Minions again is already worth the ticket. Follow their history in the world and how they became involved with Scarlet and Herb Overkill can be quite amusing and funny. We have some issues in the script towards the development ot their relationship and how the ending was made (except the final scene) but,in general, we have an entertaining piece after all. Nothing amazing, I highlight, just very cool and cute. Fans will enjoy it.

Attending that movie in the theater is a COMPLETE waste of good money. If your kid must see it, rent the DVD put him or her in front of the TV and go do something else. The movie is like an animated docudrama about the history of the Minons. It is not funny, glorifies rebellion against authority, celebrates evil, seemingly takes joy in the destruction of church architecture. There is unnecessary sexuality as well. It has little plot, no theme, and no redeeming underlying message. I'd rather pay full price to watch Ishtar in the theater rather than see this movie again. Yes, I said Ishtar.

i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions i hate the minions
The Movie Was a disappointment .They Showed Almost the Whole Movie in the Trailer.The Movie Wasn't Funny at all .They Plot wasn't That Good. Minions Language Gets Annoying Halfway through the Movie.

It was a bad movies, if you aren´t 5 years old, you´ll not like this movie, despicable me 1 and 2 i love that movies but minions was very bad, thanks minions inside out hasn´t a rival for the OSCAR, You think with this movie that British are retarded

This film is maybe the worst of the Despicable Me saga, but keep in mind, it's a mindless comedy and you need to go in expecting that or you definitely will not enjoy this film. Minions is dumb but funny slapstick humor. Bullock and Hamm are also great in their roles. Unfortunately, most of the good slapstick was given away in the trailers, hurting my rating of this film. Minions is a film that you can get a kick out of watching once, but no more than that.
As if he does not have anything like the first two films, but it's still a movie that say, is worth seeing    .

This movie is the funniest movie, next to Jack and Jill. The actors are really good and have a depth in their humour that even adult will laugh for weeks after. If you hate the minions, your opinions will change after watching this. I now only buy products with minions on them !
Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.Meh.

Whilst these gooey lemons weren't the focus of Despicable Me, they were without a doubt the stars. As great as Gru was, not a single kid or adult left cinemas without at some point going "Bannana!" So it makes sense that they should end up getting a movie all of their own, that still has the same great animation and visual gags that made the franchise enjoyable to begin with.

Funny in spots, but thinly plotted prequel to Despicable Me. Will probably be more popular with the kids than their parents. Strangely, the minions themselves were quite amusing, its their human co-stars that are just way over the top.

The movie is funny. That's all it was designed for and that's all I can give it. But there is no artistic merit, no real emotional story. It's as scatter brained as the eponymous title characters of the film. The  'Despicable Me' movies had a balance of the Minions' slapstick humour. It doesn't make any sense, but then, you'd be as dumb as these minions to have expected it to make sense.

With how popular they have become, it comes as no surprise that Illumination Entertainment wanted to make a film based entirely around the Minions. Thus enters the "Despicable Me" spinoff "Minions," which is nowhere near as good as the previous film, but still pretty entertaining. It's pretty clear that the Minions can't lift the movie on their own and work better as side characters, and the villains here aren't really the greatest of characters, but "Minions" is still colorful, funny, exciting, and pretty entertaining. I would definitely temper your expectations with this one, but expect "Minions" to still be a pretty good animated film in the end.

After watching the first two Despicable Me films I would've argued with you until I was blue in the face that the Minions could lead their own film. I was wrong. Minions serves as a spinoff/prequel to Despicable Me and I did find a few things interesting at the beginning of the movie that had the Minions interfering with some of the most important moments and oddities in the worlds history but it quickly feels like it is running in circles over and over until the end of the movie. This movie has practically 0 heart and 0 development. The Minions just spend the whole movie running around causing mischief and ruining things and they are not nearly as funny as they were in the first two Despicable Me movies. The side characters needed to be good in this movie as well because the Minions obviously don't speak English and this were forgettable throughout. Its just an overall disappointing film that could have been so much better.

Although it can get to entertain to the great fans of the last two deliveries and even if it gives a more or less good story for a prequel, Minions feels for most of us like an overwhelming comedy, and even if it brings a few silly laughs, Minions is still not as smoothly as its most successful predecessors.

As a person that thought that liked the first two Despicable Me movies a lot, I thought it had something special about them. It had the villain named Gru who had a special love and care for the three orphan girls. However, the funniest thing about the movie was the minions that bring a lot of laughs that come in small doses. Now, the directors of Despicable Me take the minions into the lead role in their own movie and the result is a fun, uneven movie set in the 60’s.
A wonderful movie for all ages to enjoy and have fun Watching it. The movie is funny but it's hard to understand the minions because they don't speak English! Colorful and I recommend.
Expectations were high but movies was not.

An okay comedy. Half of the jokes are funny but it gives a pretty good backstory of the minions.It doesnt give that much detail but at least we have the backstory.If you love the Despicable Me movies youre gonna enjoy this.But if youre going in blind or expecting something more youre gonna hate this movie.

Good for little kids 12 years & below but certainly NOT for an older crowd. At the beginning the movie started interesting with the history of the minions but then it quickly got boring and predictable till the end...

I love the minions. They are so funny, adorable and bumbling. I love their odd language and the way they resort to violence when annoyed. So, me and my friends went to see the minions movie. I barley laughed once. It had n over the top villain, a messy story and the funniest parts are the short sequence at the beginning and the five seconds with young Gru at the end. This was miles away from the quality of Despicable Me 1 and 2.
a decent Spin off of the beloved minions but a bad story line and the jokes don't land, could be improved
Its not nearly as memorable as its predecessors, but minions still boats stunning animation and some clever gags to still be a reasonably entertaining movie.
Minions Is Very Funny Movie Minions Is Funny Actor Is Good Songs Is Good Credits Very Funny

Despite my initial reservations about a movie based entirely around the Minions, who serve the purpose of comic relief (in their harmless, non-psycho yellow form, that is) in the two Despicable Me movies, I actually enjoyed this movie immensely. That said, I had the benefit of watching it at home rather than in the theaters, where I could easily hear the jokes over my own laughter instead of having to strain for them over both my own laughter and that of dozens of small children.

The Minions is fine for what it is. A short hour and a half of the Minions that will mildly entertain you. While Illumination nails the visual elements in the film and the Minions don’t make you sick of them it definitely doesn’t lack the punch of the first film. The film is so focused on firing rapid fire jokes that it forgets to provide some heart. While some of the jokes work some just provide a mild chuckle and without that umph that the first film had this can’t help but feeling like a candy bar. Lot of sugar but low on energy. That’s because it is. The film is just an hour and a half of the Minions walking around talking to each other. For die-fans of the franchise this will be all they want/need. For everyone else though the film is kind of cute. The Minions are funny but they cannot sustain a whole movie on their own. Without a character like Gru to ground the film and occasionally cut to the Minions for bursts of laughter the film can’t help but feel hollow. Its mildly entertaining but unlike Shaun the Sheep, another spin-off film with side characters that speak gibberish, there is nothing to sing home about good for one viewing but that’s about it.

This Despicable Me spin-off shows that the series comic relief characters are funny enough to hold their own in a movie without the help of a super villain in the spotlight. I'm not saying it will stand out in time as one of those exceptional animated movies from which every one that follows should take note, but it's got enough laughs to keep things enjoyable for the whole family.
*meh* That pretty much sums up my thoughts on this movie.
Minions, an obvious cash grab from Illumination Entertainment does what it is set out to do, entertain little kids and make billions of dollars in the process.

Shame on you - whoever is responsible for this stupid movie. Lot of scenes that only adult people can understand, but overall its SO MUCH BORING movie for adult people. I think only kids 5-10 y.o. can enjoy by watching this movie.

Minions is the story of what happened before and leading up to Despicable Me. The minions go from one master to the next all through out time and it's quite funny see who they serve and why that person is probably dead. Seeing all the Minions act as a group doing everything is hilarious, also like little yellow elves. Movies like this are obviously made with kids in focus but there are a large amount and I mean laaarge amount of jokes that kids will not understand, there's something extra humorous about extremely adult humor in the middle of a film like this. Animation is also absolutely beautiful, even the littlest details are there to add that extra touch.When you go into a movie like minions you know what your getting and if you have a open or light sense of humor you will love minions and if you don't I'm sure you will even still enjoy it.
The movie wasn't bad, but it was kind of a disappointment. A good movie to see with the family. Not an Academy Award winning movie by ANY means but still, it can produce a laugh here and there.

It was a fun movie, I don't rate it that high because I'm not as big of a fan of minions as some other people are and maybe the fact that I haven't seen Despicable me doesn't help either, but if you seen that movie you might like this more than me

Minions I thought that going to be the movie of the year , because that 's minions are very famous for the Despicable Me duology, but in critical that humiliation , but at the box office 'll take a break.

As much of a corporate sellout it looks like, Minions is a true gem of a movie. The film had some amazing slapstick gags, where the minions are just as silly and adorable as they were in the Despicable Me films. Although the plot can drag on at times, the movie has one of the best climaxes I've seen in a comedy, let alone a kid's movie.

The Minions film is fun and entertaining that despite its' silliness, it manages to bring a good story line with few dialogue included and many pop culture references.Overall, Minions will please fans of the despicable films.
This movie had a well designed super villain, amusing scenes, and the characters were decently fleshed out, though it could have done with a slightly more developed narrative.

Es soprendente que Minions sea una de las mas taquilleras del año. Los Minions para mi siempre serán grandes personajes animados,ellos supieron hacer reir a la gente en las películas de Despicable Me,y tambien lograrón hacer reir en su propia película y aunque tiene ciertos problemas en el guión como la razón de que Scarlet Overkill se hace la villana del filme o Kevin como protagonista en el ultimo tercio de la película,sigo pensando que es un filme decente. it's funny, and the adventures are great. The history of the minions is done correctly, and this movie is super duper underrated, I do not understand what problems the people say that have with the movie. Also I love King Bob.

For the fans of the minions, be prepared to enjoy a film so adorable and pretty funny. I did like the idea of putting the minions in their own movie, which it did an awesome job on keeping it kind of original. This movie is not just for kids, it also targeted for older audience because it offers humor that I doubt a child will get since it has some inside jokes that are often hilarious. Other than that, this movie delivers cheer and hilarity throughout the film.

This movie is a cash grab it's just meant to sell toys. Older audiences will be bored out of there mind but I guess if you have a 1-9 year olds they will probably love all the unfunny jokes. I laughed once in this movie and I don't want to spoil the joke but all the other jokes are just terrible. The animation and acting are good but the story, humor, characters, and the overall movie are bad. If you have 1-9 year olds go see it with them if they really want to but if not just ignore this movie.
I am a great fan of despicable me movies and i loved this one. The minions are so funny i just adore them.

It starts off pretty funny but then just get's pretty lame, this is obviously only enjoyed by children, and i love cartoons and animated films but this movie really isn't that great. Minions are everywhere now, they used to be cute and funny, now their straight up annoying. the only way you can enjoy this is if you speak Italian because that's the language their speaking so it's pretty dumb. Not worth your time, but maybe your children time

The Minions pretty much had their moments. Good, but a bit bad at the same time. It's pretty much one of the watchable movies (Along with Despicable Me and 2) to stay in tune for Despicable Me 3 coming on your way.

My TOP-10 WORST and disappointing animated movies of all time, that's it. I can't review this because I think it's already reviewed by yourselves. I'm just going to say that its silliness are annoying and becoming nastier. (0%)

Minions is a disappointing, and yet kind of enjoyable movie. The begging is actually my favourite part, where it shows how the minions wanted to serve evil from the start. But as it went on, it got boring, annoying, and just not what I expected it to be.

Minions is the much anticipated spin off of the hit series despicable me. There are a lot of funny parts in this film and the human characters are the highlight of the film. I also liked the beginning of the film where the minions are travelling through time. However these good thing don't improve this disappointing movie. Firstly, as they are minions it is a bit frustrating because we don't know what they are talking about, and the film didn't do a good job of explaining through actions. Secondly, I felt the way the minions came to be in grus possession was a bit anti climactic, and don't get me started on all the plot holes. Finally, I think the reason this movie was made was for cash, not for entertainment. So many kids were obsessed with minions and if they made a movie then the cash would come rolling in. In the end I would say it isn't the worst animated film, and kids will enjoy it but anyone else will not.

Ok I love the dispicable me movies. I think there both entertaining for both kids and adults alike. However minions is a not very funny movies amid amnly at kids. Now before you start thinking well it's a movie made for kids so cut it some slack hear me out. I Have seen many family movies. Some good some really good and some bad. This one is just OK. Like the peanuts movies this one is manly amid at kids. The peanuts movie accomplished something that the minions could not. Being an entertaining movie for both kids and adults alike. The peanuts had references from the old charlie brown movies wile being a short sweet and fun movie with top notch voice acting. That is another review though . Back to minions. This movie was just OK. Yeah it was entertaining at some spots but i feel the script didn't have much to work with and neither did scarlet overkill. She sounds like a cool villain but she just did not deliver.
Filme muito engraçado, otima ideia fazer um spin-off dele. e o 2º filme de animação mais assistidos do cinema. e muito bom pra familia toda. e eles vao voltar no Meu malvado Favorito 3

Minions is a family-friendly film, full of great comedy a good animation. Sadly, after the worldwide-succes of Despicable Me, and the legendary succes of Despicable Me 2 (that would not be possible with not-Farrell Willimas), Minions makes the audience to pay for continue watching a film that a just tells us how did the Minons met Gru and all the Despicable Me's stuff. This could be a bad film, but not for a bit more of the 60% of the audience.
The Minions used to be o.k. and all, but now their popularity has gone too far. What was bad about this movie was focusing on the now annoying minions and very surreal parts.
I am not one of those people who got obsessed with the minions so this movie is cute and all but I think those were the people it was meant for. The kids loved it though!
While this movie didn't reach my expectations with an bland plot, it's still an charm for younger children and can generate an few laughs within adults as well.
The prequel to the Despicable Me movies, Minions shows us how Minions came to be. This is the funniest by far of the three movies, but the plot wasn't all that good. It's still enjoyable, though.

While it has it's funny moments, Minions fails to help the entertainment mark Despicable Me 1 & 2 hit. Most of the side characters aren't funny, the villain is terrible, and the minions can only be funny for so long.
this movie is just plan dumb plus i hate all the minons they r so ugly and dumb i hate it btw all the movies suck i hate them all just go watch steven universe is much better
Bo-ring.  Sorry - I think the minions are cute and everything but I didn't even realize they weren't speaking a language until my aunt pointed it out.  Plus, my whole concept of time was screwed up.
Minions is funny and definitely inoffensive.
My son Calvyn and I watched Minions in Carmike Cinemas. I watched in the end of Minions credits about the song of Revolution by the musical guest The Beatles.

You can make a movie with just minions; there have been silent comedies in the past. You just have to make it funny. That's exactly where this movie fails; it's not that funny. The villain is not funny and the supporting characters are not that funny either. Coffin and Balda and their team of animators could have easily made a better movie had they had a more polished and imaginative script. Instead, they got the screenwriter of the Despicable Me theme park ride.
This is a great movie.  The story was good. It even got me into Illumination Entertainment. Too bad it received mixed reviews among critics. I wish it would at least received positive reviews.
